DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Dissection Region Histology Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The class of cells identifiable based on their structure and arrangement within an area or portion of a biological sample which is different than the ones previously specified.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue, usually for further analysis or study._An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue, usually for further analysis or study.

Property.preferredDefinition: An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria.:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established biological, administrative, economic, demographic, etc. criteria.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
